cases.stem: 56M presents with sudden onset chest pain radiating to his jaw.

investigations.name: ECG
investigations.result: ST elevation in leads II, III, and aVF

investigations.name: ABG
investigations.result: No acid-base disturbance / evidence of respiratory failure

investigations.name: Coags
investigations.result:
apTT and INR normal 
D-dimer and fibrinogen elevated

investigations.name: TFT
investigations.result: TSH, T3 and T4 within normal limits

investigations.name: Echocardiogram
investigations.result: Hypokinesis of the inferior wall with an ejection fraction of 45%

investigations.name: CXR
investigations.result: Normal cardiac silhouette, no pulmonary oedema or consolidation.

investigations.name: Coronary Angiogram
investigations.result: 90% occlusion of the right coronary artery

investigations.name: CT Angiogram
investigations.result: 90% occlusion of the right coronary artery

investigations.name: Stress Test
investigations.result: Patient condition becomes a lot worse...

questions.prompt: What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is your immediate supportive management?

options: PCI within 90 minutes / fibrinolysis within 12 hours
PCI within 6 hours / fibrinolysis within 24 hours
questions.correctOption: PCI within 90 minutes / fibrinolysis within 12 hours

questions.prompt: What pathological changes would you expect to see on autopsy within 24 hours?
options: Coagulative necrosis, inflammatory changes, eosinophilic infiltrate
Pink granulation tissue, angiogenesis, collagen deposition
Coagulative necrosis, collagen deposition, myocyte swelling
questions.correctOption: Coagulative necrosis, inflammatory changes, eosinophilic infiltrate

cases.stem: 66F presents with dizziness, breathlessness and palpitations over the last 3 hours. She denies any chest pain but feels 'weak and shaky'.

investigations.name: ECG
investigations.result: Irregularly irregular rhythm with no discernible P waves

investigations.name: ABG
investigations.result: No acid-base disturbance / evidence of respiratory failure

investigations.name: Coags
investigations.result:
apTT and INR normal 
D-dimer and fibrinogen elevated

investigations.name: TFT
investigations.result: TSH, T3 and T4 within normal limits

investigations.name: Echocardiogram
investigations.result: Dilated left atrium, normal LV function

investigations.name: CXR
investigations.result: Normal cardiac silhouette, no pulmonary oedema or consolidation.

investigations.name: CT Angiogram
investigations.result: Dilated left atrium with no pulmonary embolism

investigations.name: Stress Test
investigations.result: Patient condition becomes a lot worse...

investigations.name: Right Heart Catheterisation
investigations.result: Elevated right atrial pressure and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure

questions.prompt: What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the role of calculating a CHADSVASC score in a patient with AF?
options: To decide between rate and rhythm control strategies
To determine the risk of stroke
To determine the risk of a heart failure exacerbation
To determine the risk of DVT
questions.correctOption: To determine the risk of stroke

questions.prompt: This patient is stable with a CHADSVASC score of 3. What is your management plan?
options: Rate control, anticoagulation, cardioversion to be considered
Rhythm control, anticoagulation, cardioversion to be considered
Rate control, antiplatelets, cardioversion to be considered
questions.correctOption: Rate control, anticoagulation, cardioversion to be considered

questions.prompt: What drugs are considered first line for rate control?
options: Beta blockers and non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers
Amiodarone and dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers
questions.correctOption: Beta blockers and non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers
